Incorporate this comprehensive research context: - Thick Client: Local processing app (e.g., Outlook, Teams) vs. Thin Client (server-heavy). Attack surface: local files/registry/memory, multiple comm channels (TCP/UDP sockets, named pipes, RPC, proprietary/custom binaries; beyond HTTP). - Architectures: 2-Tier (Client UI + DB), 3-Tier (Client UI + App Logic Server + DB). - Pentesting: Binary analysis, decompilation (dnSpy), runtime hooking (Frida), process monitoring (ProcMon), traffic capture (Wireshark). Vulns: Insecure deserialization, hardcoded creds. - Sources: OWASP Testing Guide v4 (Client-Side), SANS Reading Room 'Pentesting Thick Clients', PayloadsAllTheThings/Thick-Client. SCAFFOLDING LAYERS: Generate cards grouped by these 4 layers [Insert full scaffolding_layers from JSON above]. FLASHCARD SCHEMA: Strictly follow [Insert full flashcard_schema from JSON above]. Output as JSON array of objects, each with 'front', 'back' (nested object), 'layer', 'blooms_level'. Voter priorities: Emphasize completeness on 'Multiple Communication Channels' (protocols, tools, methodologies), pedagogy via Bloom's/active elements. Generate high-quality, optimized flashcards now.
